Europe would be better off with the responsible, mature response to the Russian proposals on security guarantees in Europe." In an address to the nation, the president of Ukraine, Volodymyr Zelensky, appeared to want to calm tensions, saying that a National Security and Defense Council meeting had concluded that the situation was under control and there was no need to panic.

The government in Kiev has asked repeatedly for reassurances from the West that Russia won't simply be allowed to roll into Ukraine, assurances that Washington and NATO have been reluctant to give, all the while reassuring Moscow that Ukraine won't be allowed to join the Western military alliance. What the Western governments are saying is that their defensive reinforcements fall under NATO's Article 5 commitments. That is, that an attack against one is treated as an attack against all.
